item.title: Rath Yatra Festival
item.dc:creator: Sukanta Pal
item.description: Before explaining what is Rath Yatra Festival(ରଥଯାତ୍ରା) or Festival of...
item.content:encoded:
Before explaining what is Rath Yatra Festival(ରଥଯାତ୍ରା) or Festival of Chariots need to understand the history of this Hindu festival, the main deity that is worshipped during the Rath yatra Festival, that is Krishna’s (an incarnation of Vishnu also a major deity in Hinduism) avatar Lord Jagannath (​​​Friend of the Universe) with his brother Balarama & sister Subhadra.

Rath Yatra Festival(ରଥଯାତ୍ରା) or Chariot Festival happened every year month June or July (monsoon season), it’s a Hindu festival associated with Lord Jagannath held in Puri (the state of Odisha, India) It is the oldest Ratha Yatra, The festival commemorates Jagannath’s annual visit to Gundicha Temple (maternal aunt’s home/Masir Bari) aka as Shoja Rath and Return Journey to his Temple aka as Ulto Rath.

Rituals/Tradition – Not only in Puri, Odisha this Rath Yatra Festival happened in the World with their respective history of this festival. So it will vary in terms of Rath Design and the process of celebrating it. The basic ritual followed everywhere, Rath Yatra’s morning the Triad Deities of Jagannath bring from the main temple with escort and seated respective one Single Rath or separate 3 Rath or Chariots for respective deities. After that, it’s driven by devote/people with help of a rope attached in front of the Chariot and controlled the direction by the respective person standing from Chariot. This procession stopped by many locations so that people can do offer puja also control the road traffic. After reached the destination stayed 1 Week or 8/9 days and then return journey called as Ulto Rath arrive at the main temple. On this occasion, the most popular Rather Mela (Rath fair) happened on the premises & lots of programmes, puja and all performed. Main food attraction of Rather Mela is Jilapi/জিলিপি (Jalebi Sweet) and Papor Vaja/পাঁপড় ভাজা (papad fry).

List of Kolkata’s Rath Yatra Festival

  • ISKCON (International Society for Krishna Consciousness) Rath Yatra
  • Bonedi Barir Rath Yatra Festival
  • Puri’s Rath Yatra Festival 2022

Rath Yatra Festival Dates by Year 

The Triad Deities of Jagannath 

Apart from Jagannath other two deities are from the left Balarama (बलराम) is an elder brother of Jagannath(Krishna), also known as Haladhara, Halayudha, Baladeva, Balabhadra and Sankarshana. From Center Subhadra (सुभद्रा) is a younger sister of Jagannath(Krishna) and Balarama and Right Side Jagannath himself.

History of Jagannath, Hinduism – The appearance of a god as a human (Incarnation) like Jesus Christ, was an influencer and Founder of Christianity likewise Krishna for Hinduism (Unlike other religions, Hinduism has no one founder but is instead a fusion of various beliefs). After the death of that human/Story, we were influenced and worshipped in different forms like idols, Photos and all, because of their legacy and great contribution.

item.title: Karva Chauth Celebrations in West Bengal
item.dc:creator: Sukanta Pal
item.description: Karwa Chauth (करवा चौथ) is one of the major festivals,...
item.content:encoded:
Karwa Chauth (करवा चौथ) is one of the major festivals, celebrated widely throughout the country, in such pandemic situations at home, abiding all covid safety norms, in new normal way. Its said that while gods had a battle with Ashuras, the Goddess Parvati, Lakshmi, Saraswati and others kept fast for their husbands and wished for their victory over evil power. Since then women on this day fast and pray for their husband’s long life and safety.

It’s a festival celebrated by Hindu women from the Indian Subcontinent on the fourth day after Purnima (a full moon) in the month of Kartika. Like many Hindu festivals, Karwa Chauth is based on the lunisolar calendar which accounts for all astronomical positions, especially positions of the moon which is used as a marker to calculate important dates. The festival falls on the fourth day after the full moon, in the Hindu lunisolar calendar month of Kartik. On Karwa Chauth, married women, especially in North India, observe fast from sunrise to moonrise for the safety and longevity of their husbands. The Karwa Chauth fast is traditionally celebrated in the states of Delhi, Haryana, Rajasthan, Gujarat Punjab, Jammu and Kashmir, Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, Himachal Pradesh and Madhya Pradesh. It is celebrated as Atla Tadde in Andhra Pradesh.

In a New Normal Way, in a remote village of Bihar, where I went today to document and meanwhile took some short clippings, which I compiled with one of my favourite karwa chauth songs for you all to take a look at the rituals women perform for their husbands.

Year Date of Karwa Chauth 

2018 27 October

2019 17 October

2020 4 November

2021 24 October

“Aayi raat suhagon wali O chaand ko dekhoon haath main jodoon Karwa chauth ka vrat main todoon…” Yeh Sas-Bahu Ki Jodi hain anmol, Bahar Kaam se Gaye huye Pati aur Sasur aj Karwa Chauth pe ghar nahi ay paye, par unke lambi umar ke liye Vrat rakhte huye aj Chand ko dekhte Muskurate huye apne apne vrat today in sas-bahu ne.. Happy Karwa Chauth

item.title: Making of Diwali Firecrackers
item.dc:creator: Sukanta Pal
item.description: This time of the year when we officially celebrate with...
item.content:encoded:
This time of the year when we officially celebrate with firecrackers or crackers(Bazi). Happy to see that now most of the sound firecrackers are very less popular and people also avoid buying them, only celebrating with the lights. Kali Puja, Diwali, Dev Deepawali or any other name you call it; this festival boasts the making of lights, that can be crackers, electric lights or Diya and many more. This is the prime time of selling and manufacturing firecrackers or Bazi market increase. 

Chamahati and Nungi(also Called Nangi) are famous for making firecrackers (Manufacturing hub) of West Bengal. They are making Green Firecrackers for over a decade, due to some restrictions and flood now production very less in terms of the previous year. Champahati’s Haral Village is the maker of crackers when Diwali or kali puja near they sell their crackers roadside temporary shops and also those who have permanent shops sell them also. Those crackers made in Champahati are very cheap but other crackers imported from are not so cheap because those are not produced here. If you want to buy some crackers or wholesale purpose visit Champahati Rail Staton, it’s nearby Champahati Bazi Market.

Nungi is a neighbourhood in the Maheshtala of the South 24 Parganas district in the Indian state of West Bengal. It is a part of the area covered by the Kolkata Metropolitan Development Authority (KMDA). Champahati is a census town and a gram panchayat within the jurisdiction of the Baruipur police station in the Baruipur community development block in the Baruipur subdivision of the South 24 Parganas district in the Indian state of West Bengal. They now make eco-friendly crackers that anyone can buy and easy to sell and top of it environmentally friendly. Slowly now the trend of Sky lantern or fanush flying followed by traditional Diya is more popular when comes to celebrating Diwali or Kali Puja in Kolkata. 

On this occasion of Kali Puja, a few bonedi houses (Bonedi Barir Kali Puja Kolkata or Fanush Bari) of Kolkata or heritage houses of Calcutta flying fanush or hot air balloon in Kolkata (Calcutta). The most popular house is Bholanath Dham Family (33/2, Beadon Street, Kolkata – 700006), after Durga Puja, they started making fanush at their home’s Thakurdalan, it takes time to make because those fanush are big in size also designed fanush lots of paper cutting involved, that’s why it’s very time consuming to make lots of patience and skill is required to make one good fanush or hot air balloon. Every year on the day of Kali Puja Afternoon (around 2-3 pm) they started flying fanush or hot air balloons from their courtyard along with fanush enthusiasts, friends and family; fanush makers are also there for support and help to make it successful. This spectacular fanush flying event was documented by photographers; day by day the number of photographers increase, it’s great to see that fanush flying becoming a trend in Kolkata. 

Started with Fanush Flying event in Kolkata, now Sky lantern or Chinese Lantern are very much popular for eco-friendly and opportunity for great profile picture or Facebook DP, it’s looking good and happy exercise for all of them. Different communities like Photographers, clubs, Residencies or Housing complex people now take it seriously and fanush flying or Sky lantern now trend in Kolkata. In Kolkata we called fanush (Manush Fanush) because it’s started or we know from Bholanath Dham Ajoy Dutt’s house, that’s why that name referred from since then. 

Kolkata Fireworks store or shop previously held at Sahid Minar Ground like fair for selling crackers on The occasion of Diwali and Kali Puja, now happened on Sithir More Circus Ground.

item.title: Bonedi Barir Laxmi Puja Kolkata
item.dc:creator: Sukanta Pal
item.description: One of the most popular or would say famous in...
item.content:encoded:
One of the most popular or would say famous in terms of business and involvement by people is Durga Puja Kolkata. This is by far one of the major annual festivals or king of the festival in terms of popularity, grandeur and showcase for international tourism in Kolkata(Calcutta). When this Durga Puja ends people became sad and count days for next year Durga Puja 2022. That time knocking door another puja called Kojagori Lakshmi Pooja or Laxmi Puja. Though this puja basically happened during homes of households almost every house and few Bonedi bari’s of Kolkata take it next label.

But some pandal or Puja Committee hold this puja as well because it’s a few days after Durga puja, they do the puja in the same pandal where Durga idol was there. Even they bought idols at the same time when they bought the Durga idol and extra ordered for the Laxmi idol too. In the same pandal, they worshipped Laxmi Puja on a very small scale. This way they do two pujas back to back one is Durga Puja and another is Laxmi Puja (The day of Laxmi Puja Kolkata 20th Oct 2021). দুগ্গা দুগ্গা করে লক্ষ্মী এলো ঘরে (Dugga Dugga kore lakkhi Elo Ghore) be like. This Laxmi Puja Kolkata, Kojagori Lakshmi Puja or Lakhi puja whatever name you call it, it’s actually followed by a diverse community of Kolkata. Bengali family hold this Puja called or referred to as Kojagori Laxmi Puja. Other communities hold as Laxmi Puja. These Puja attractions are Alpona given by women (anyone), Preparing Bhog like Naru (Sweets made of Coconut), Sinni, Murki, Chire and many other delicious food items. Lakshmi Pooja happens in the evening (Sharad Purnima) followed by Conch Sounds and reciting Lakshmi Pacnachli. 

Sharad Purnima (also known as Kumara Purnima(କୁମାର ପୂର୍ଣ୍ଣିମା ), Kojagiri Purnima, Navanna Purnima, or Kaumudi Purnima is a harvest festival celebrated on the full moon day of the Hindu lunar month of Ashvin (September to October), marking the end of the monsoon season. On this auspicious day, many divine pairs like Radha Krishna, Shiva Parvati, and Lakshmi Narayan are worshipped along with the moon and are offered flowers and kheer (sweet dish made of rice and milk). Deities in temples are usually dressed in white colour signifying the brightness of the moon. Many people observe full day fasting on this day. This day is celebrated differently in different parts of the country. In Odisha, on this day unmarried women keep fast with the popular belief of getting their suitable groom(kumara). This festival starts with maidens welcoming the sun god just at sunrise with a coconut-leaf-made-vessel called ‘kula’ filled with fried paddy containing 7 fruits like coconut, banana, cucumber, betel nut, sugar-cane, guava followed by ‘Aarti’. In the evening they break their fast by preparing a dish containing the fried paddy of the morning along with the fruits, curd, and jaggery to offer the moon god before the ‘tulsi’ plant. After this maidens play games and sing songs under the light of the full moon. In many parts of Gujarat, Garba (a form of dance) takes place in the presence of moonlight. The Kojagari Purnima concerns the observance of the Kojagara Vrata. People perform this Vrata under the moonlight after fasting for the day. Lakshmi, the Hindu Goddess of Wealth, is significantly worshipped on this day as it is believed to be her birthday. Lord Indra, the God of Rains, along with his elephant Airavata is also worshipped. It is believed that on the night of Sharad Purnima, the raas (a form of dance) of Radha Krishna also takes place along with their gopis. 

Many households don’t bring Protima or Lakshmi idol they do the puja on Permanent idol called kulodebota(কুলদেবতা) or Protisthito Thakur, some others do it in Lakshi Sora (লক্ষ্মী সরা) or Pot refers to, some do it another idol and some mix of both Laxmi idol and kulodebota. 

When you go after Durga puja in Kumartuli (World Biggest and famous Pottery or idol makers lives there) lots of Laxmi idol, Pot or Sora are for sale along with accessories like jewellery, saree, alpona sticker and many more items that required for decoration or indirectly essential items for puja. This year 2021 after covid-19 lots of buyers visits kumartuli because now most peoples are vaccinated and case are low. Also this year because of rain people also buy plastic to cover the idol after purchasing it, so that they can safely bring it home without being drenched by water. Thai festival for 2 days long, day after puja they immersed the idol on the Ganges and those who have a permanent idol and others they don’t do the immersion part.

Another Festival next Door.

item.title: Ganesh Chaturthi Festival in Kolkata
item.dc:creator: Sukanta Pal
item.description: How Kolkata dominant Durga Puja likewise Ganesh Puja Lead by...
item.content:encoded:
How Kolkata dominant Durga Puja likewise Ganesh Puja Lead by Mumbai (Bombay). Most popular and celebrated festival in Mumbai. Nowadays though Kolkata also try to catch the trend and bring idol from Mumbai itself (not ordering from Kumartuli). So this way slowly the number of Ganesh Puja increasing year by year. This Ganesh Puja Started on 10th September 2021. 

These rituals are performed during the 10-day long festival. They are namely Pranapratishhtha, Shhodashopachara, Uttarpuja, and Ganpati Visarjan. The excitement of Ganesh Chaturthi settles in weeks before the festival actually begins. Artisans start preparing clay idols of Ganesha in different poses and sizes.

Now the Shree Siddhivinayak Ganapati Mandir in Kolkata. A Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shri Ganesh. It is located in The 48B Muktaram Babu Street. It is one of the richest temples in India(Mumbai One). 

On the last day of the festival, the tradition of Ganesh Visarjan takes place. The concluding day of the 10-day festival is also popularly known as Anant Chaturdashi. As the word ‘visarjan’ implies, on this day immersion (‘visarjan’ means immersion) of Lord Ganapati’s idol takes place in a river, sea or water body. On the first day of the festival, the devotees mark the beginning of Ganesh Chaturthi with the placement of Lord Ganesha’s idol in their homes, public places and offices. On the last day, the devotees come out in processions carrying the idols of their beloved God and perform immersion.

item.title: Saroter Kashful – Land of Kash Grass
item.dc:creator: Sukanta Pal
item.description: In my childhood, I didn’t know about kashful stories or...
item.content:encoded:
In my childhood, I didn’t know about kashful stories or association with Durga Puja, so it was ignored, only I noticed a kashful nearby idol when it’s decked up and ready for Puja. During Autumn’s season when I used to go to school, the most preferred and best transport was cycling and walking. My School was situated beside the river. While I was travelling for school this Autumn Season and in other seasons also I saw White grass around the bank of the river and a corner of different portions. That time I didn’t feel about Kashful, maybe no one told me or I experienced such nostalgic and aesthetic pleasure of it. I can see every day lots of kashful around me but I never that label of interest to go closer and bring it to my home.

One of the biggest reasons was that time Internet was not available or a device to access it, yes I’m talking about that era, now when I look back that was a time when I spent the most time with nature and observing each and every movement. At that time I didn’t know about photography or filmmaking, I basically didn’t have access to cameras, most of my time was spent with nature and offline with friends and alone. When I look back I’m so happy, because of that I developed a different connection with nature and human beings around us. See here I want to know everything not just specific nature or human beings, most observations or would say priority first was nature then human, and others. Now I have learned, watched, listened to and connected lots of stories and linked with Durga puja. It gives me goosebumps. In a way, I experienced all of the things before knowing it, which gives me enough joy and want to explore or picturise it in my way. 

Now I know everything like Satyajit Ray’s film Pather Panchali Trail line scene where apu and Durga, Rabindra Sangeet and others Pujor gaan, Autumn season, Ma Asche and many more. All of the things are now visualised with what I’m seeing, basically kashful photos or footage I saw everywhere along with a Durga idol or related to Durga puja. It’s very fascinating to me believe it or not I never touch kashful by hand, and always wanted that experience. To be very honest without education and knowledge I never given importance to kashful, most ignored that time like background dancer. Childhood ignorance or without proper knowledge, after knowing the fact I missed a lot and want to experience it all over again. 

That journey was very memorable when I’m into filmmaking, photography, design and many other creative fields, because of this I have friends who also want to document or explore Kashful in a different way. At that time one of the popular social media was Facebook, we saw lots of friends updating their profile with Kashful and travelling to the land of Kash. During the Autumn season in the year of 2016 (Durga Puja), we first time travelling Palla Road nearby Bardhaman for Kashful. What an experience and journey started. That time I don’t have DSLR Camera only have Apple iPad Air 2 Device.

I used my iPad as a Camera and clicked lots of photos and some videos. I snapped lots of photos reason was I don’t know or have too much information, I should document everything so that later on I can reconnect and understand better way. In that mindset I was not photographing, I was documenting without knowing it. That’s why clicked lots of photos, now I think if I added every photo it looks like a video, because a very short period of time I snapped more photos, afraid of, If I missed anything or if the photo was not clicked or different thoughts keep in mind, looks like burst mode I used manually. That’s the reason I have backed memories and reconnect or study my activities very well and share photos in my blog. That habit helped me fall in love with the documentation in the research field. 

One of the most important things was that time I wanted to make a film about my journey and upload it to YouTube, At that time I don’t know about anything like VLOGS (not popular or people don’t know about it), travel Videos and so on. Even though vlogs were not popular in India and other countries as well, few people are actually doing it. We prefer that time blogging only. There was no plan that I want to make videos of kashful or film documentation, it was only planned was photographing, kashful that’s enough for excitement and closer looks and of course touch the kashful.

During the journey, lots of things happened and then started filming it, small things like inside train and basic shots. When we reached Palla Road we take Groupie for Facebook, for blog and documenting memories. Then the process started when can we see kashful we’re almost there. Looks like I can’t describe that process, I will add a Podcast episode in future here.

item.title: Krishna Janmashtami Festival Celebrated by Kolkata’s Heritage Houses
item.dc:creator: Sukanta Pal
item.description: After Jhulan Purnima or Jhulan Utsav, one of the main...
item.content:encoded:
After Jhulan Purnima or Jhulan Utsav, one of the main and biggest festivals of Vaishnava traditions (Vaishnavism is one of the major Hindu denominations along with Shaivism, Shaktism, and Smartism) is Krishna Janmashtami, also known simply as Janmashtami or Gokulashtami, is an annual Hindu festival that celebrates the birth of Krishna, the eighth avatar of Vishnu. This Year 30th August 2021 celebrated Krishna Janmashtami or the Birthday of Krishna. This festival is celebrated particularly in Mathura and Vrindavan, but lots of households in different countries celebrated in their way. In Kolkata, lots of heritage houses or bonedi bari and Mandir or Temple equally celebrated Janmashtami. Early Morning Gaudia Math Bagbazar started their procession, Afternoon Partha Sarthai Mandir Started Competition for kids of becoming a character of Krishna. Also, many temples in Kolkata like ISKCON Kolkata, Jew temple and many more.

Janmashtami is celebrated every year to mark the birth anniversary of Lord Krishna. Believers observe the day by keeping a fast and praying at the temples. , was born on the eighth day of the month of Bhadra. The day mostly falls in the months of August or September as per the Western calendar. 

Krishna, who is believed to be the eighth avatar of Lord Vishnu, was born on the eighth day (Ashtami) of the Krishna Paksha (dark fortnight) of the month of Bhadrapad. Janmashtami 2021 Date in India: Janmashtami, the birth date of Lord Krishna, is celebrated widely across the country. Krishna Janmashtami is one of the biggest Hindu festivals celebrated with great pomp and show in Kolkata, India. Janmashtami is also called Gokulashtami is a big day for Krishna Devotees

The next day of Janmashtami there is Nando Utsav or Nandotsava. It’s a festival that celebrates Lord Krishna’s birth. It is believed that all the villagers of Braj visited Nand Baba’s house to see little Krishna and congratulate Mata Yashoda. Nand Baba distributed ornaments, clothes, cattle and various other valuables among saints and sages. All saints and sages bestowed blessings on Lord Krishna in return. Dahi Handi, also a tradition in Janmashtami. Kolkata’s mandir or Temple are decorated with lights, colors, lamps, thrill and fun like a bride adorns a bridal gown.
